Call 24/7/365 - We'll Come to You!

Hupy and Abraham S.C.’s Wausau personal injury law office is located at 505 S
24th Ave, near Stewart Avenue. Our Wausau personal injury attorney helps
individuals and families after car accidents, motorcycle crashes, truck
wrecks, dog bites, slip and falls, wrongful deaths, and other accidents in
Wausau and throughout Wisconsin. To schedule a free consultation, call our
office at **715-298-4400**  or fill out a form and we will promptly contact
you.

## Wausau Personal Injury Lawyer Helping Clients Make Fair Recoveries

Over the past half-century, our legal team helped more than 70,000 clients
recover more than $1 billion for their injuries. We continue to do this
important work from our office in the Galleria building in Wausau. From here,
we represent clients in Wausau and the surrounding communities, including but
not limited to Weston, Schofield, Marshfield, Antigo, Rhinelander, Stevens
Point, Wisconsin Rapids, Plover, Lacrosse, Eau Claire, Hudson, Superior, and
Ashland.

Our firm has a national reputation for excellence. Our lawyers are recognized
as Top 100 Trial Lawyers by the National Trial Lawyers, and our firm has been
voted best personal injury law firm in the Wisconsin Law Journal’s Reader
Rankings, year after year.

Insurers know that we fight hard for each and every client and that if a fair
settlement can’t be reached that we will protect our clients in court.

We are ready to use our experience and passion for the law to help you get the
recovery that you deserve. Contact us by phone at 715-298-4400, online chat,
or fill out our contact form today to have us contact you. Our office is
always open to take your call or online contact, and our Wausau office is open
for walk-ins from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday. Contact us today to
schedule a _free consultation_ , which we can do in person, by phone, or by
video conference.

## Frequently Asked Questions

### What Does an Injury Attorney Do?

A Wausau personal injury lawyer provides legal representation to victims of
accidents involving negligence or other wrongful acts. The team at Hupy and
Abraham can handle a wide variety of cases in Wisconsin and represent victims
who were involved in the following types of accidents:

  * Car or truck accidents
  * Motorcycle accidents
  * Dog bites
  * Negligent security incidents
  * Nursing home negligence or abuse
  * Slip and fall accidents
  * Drug or medical device injuries
  * Police brutality

If your loved one was killed due to another person’s negligence or act of
violence, a personal injury lawyer can help you file a wrongful death claim to
recover the damages you deserve after your loved one’s untimely death.

### How Can a Personal Injury Attorney in Wausau Help You?

A personal injury attorney in Wausau, WI, will remove the stress of a lawsuit
so you can focus on recovering from your injuries or loss. This can be done by
doing the following to help with your case:

  * Keeping your legal rights protected and advising you throughout your case.
  * Filing your personal injury claim properly and within the necessary timeframe.
  * Collecting and preserving evidence that can be used to support your case. This may include eyewitness testimony, video or photos of the accident scene, copies of medical and police reports, and anything else that can prove another party was negligent and caused your injury.
  * Placing a value on your case by calculating your losses and determining what damages you are entitled to receive.
  * Negotiating with insurance companies, so you are not forced into accepting a settlement for less than your claim is worth.
  * Representing you in court if your claim is not settled with the insurance company. A skilled personal injury lawyer will fight to ensure you get a positive outcome for your case.

### When to Hire a Wausau Personal Injury Lawyer?

It is important to hire an experienced injury lawyer as soon as possible after
being injured in an accident or incident involving negligence or wrongful
acts. A personal injury lawyer will be able to review your case and advise you
on the best course of action. They can also begin gathering evidence and
medical records from doctors to help strengthen your case. An injury lawyer
can also represent you throughout the process of negotiating with insurance
companies, making sure that you get full compensation for your losses.

There is a statute of limitations in Wisconsin for filing a personal injury
lawsuit. The statute of limitations to file a personal injury claim in
Wisconsin is three years from the date of the accident. If you do not file
your claim within this timeframe, your claim may be dismissed, and you will
not be able to pursue damages. Hiring a personal injury lawyer will ensure
that your claim is filed before the statute of limitations expires.

### How to Find the Best Personal Injury Lawyer in Wausau?

When looking for a personal injury lawyer in Wausau, WI, make sure to do your
research. Check online reviews and ask friends or family members who have been
in similar situations for recommendations. It is also important to look for an
injury lawyer with experience handling cases like yours. You may also want to
consider using a lawyer you know personally or have used for another case in
the past.

You can consider the following factors to help narrow down your choices for
the best personal injury lawyer for your case:

  * Reviewing a lawyer’s case results can give insight into what types of personal injury settlements other clients have been awarded and how many cases a specific lawyer or firm has won.
  * Past client testimonials can show the satisfaction other clients have with the firm and its lawyers.
  * Awards and accolades can give you valuable information on how the lawyer or law firm rates in the local community and the types of recognition they have received. The lawyers at Hupy and Abraham have been voted best and rated best by their clients and community.

When you have narrowed down your list of potential lawyers, set up
consultations with each lawyer to get a better feel for what Wausau personal
injury you would like to represent your case.

### What Percentage Does a PI Lawyer Take?

Personal injury lawyers typically take a contingency fee, meaning they do not
get paid until after the case has been settled or won in court. The percentage
of the fee depends on the lawyer, so it’s essential to do your research and
find out what types of fees they charge.

Most personal injury lawyers work on a contingency fee basis, meaning their
fee is based on a percentage of your final settlement or amount received in
court. Generally speaking, these fees range depending on the lawyer, the
complexity of the case, and other factors. It’s important to make sure that
you understand exactly how much your lawyer will be charging before signing
any contracts. You should also be aware that there may be additional costs
involved if the case goes to trial.

### What to Ask a Personal Injury Lawyer During a Consult

If you’ve been injured in an accident, it’s important that you know what
questions to ask when speaking with an experienced Wausau personal injury
lawyer. A successful consultation will give you the information and support
you need to make the best decision for your case.

When consulting with an injury lawyer, there are several important questions
to ask. The answers to your questions can help you make your final decision on
whether they are the right lawyer for your personal injury case. Some
questions to ask may include the following:

  * How many years have you been practicing in this field?
  * Have you handled cases similar to mine before?
  * What results have you achieved in similar personal injury cases?
  * What do you think my case is worth?
  * What type of evidence would be needed for my case?
  * Do you see any challenges or downfalls with my case?
  * Who would be my point of contact if I have questions or need updates during the duration of my case?
  * How fast do you respond if I have questions?
  * What are your preferred means of communication with your clients?
  * What time do I have to file a personal injury lawsuit in Wisconsin?
  * What are your legal fees? Do you work on a contingency?
  * Are you prepared to represent me if my personal injury case goes to trial?

Filing a personal injury claim can be stressful, so it is important that you
feel comfortable with the lawyer representing you throughout the process.
Asking these questions during your initial consultation is essential for
making sure that your case is handled properly and efficiently and that any
costs associated with it are clearly outlined from the start. If there are
doubts at your consultation about whether the lawyer is a good fit for your
case, they may not be the right choice for you.

## Directions to our Personal Injury Law Firm in Wausau, Wisconsin

### From the West (Stanley, Chippewa Falls):
